analysis_metadata.methodology: Dependency analysis, ICE scoring, technical complexity assessment, foundation-first approach

implementation_order.name: Multi-Tenant Customer Isolation
implementation_order.rationale: FOUNDATION. Multi-tenant isolation is critical infrastructure that all other enhancements depend on. Must be in place before customer-specific data ingestion. Simple Neo4j label implementation.

implementation_order.name: IEC 62443 Safety Integration
implementation_order.rationale: FOUNDATION. Safety zones (Level 0-4) establish the foundational architecture for equipment classification. Required by E08 (safety-critical systems), E09 (GDPR compliance zones), E15 (vendor equipment mapping). Well-defined TASKMASTER with 10-agent orchestration.

implementation_order.name: Vendor Equipment Integration (Siemens/Alstom)
implementation_order.rationale: FOUNDATION. Equipment models and vendor-specific characteristics are needed for SBOM analysis, vulnerability mapping, and safety assessments. Links to safety zones from E07. Enables economic and prioritization enhancements.

implementation_order.name: RAMS Reliability & Safety Module
implementation_order.rationale: SAFETY CRITICAL. Depends on safety zones (E07) and equipment data (E15). Provides reliability metrics and failure analysis needed for economic impact (E10) and prioritization (E12). Railway safety compliance driver.

implementation_order.name: GDPR Compliance & Privacy Controls
implementation_order.rationale: LEGAL REQUIREMENT. Depends on customer isolation and safety zones for data classification. Relatively independent but needed before psychometric data ingestion. Legal compliance driver with clear technical path.
implementation_order.data_protection: Sensitive personnel data handling for psychometric modules

implementation_order.name: SBOM Dependency & Vulnerability Tracking
implementation_order.rationale: SECURITY FOUNDATION. Depends on equipment models (E15) for component mapping. 10-agent swarm TASKMASTER already designed. Enables economic impact (E10), prioritization (E12), and attack path modeling (E13). High business value.
implementation_order.agents: 10-agent swarm (Parser, Validator, CVE Analyzer, EPSS Scorer, APT Linker, etc.)

implementation_order.name: Economic Impact Modeling
implementation_order.rationale: BUSINESS VALUE ENABLER. Requires reliability data (E08), vulnerability data (E03), and equipment costs (E15). Enables prioritization (E12) through ROI calculations. McKenney Q8 (compliance ROI) depends on this.
business_questions: Q8: What's the ROI of security investments?

implementation_order.name: Psychohistory Demographics Baseline
implementation_order.rationale: PSYCHOMETRIC FOUNDATION. Requires GDPR compliance (E09) for personnel data handling. Establishes demographic baseline needed for advanced psychometric modules (E19-E25). Lower risk with higher ease.

implementation_order.name: NOW-NEXT-NEVER Prioritization Framework
implementation_order.rationale: DECISION SUPPORT. Depends on economic impact (E10), vulnerability data (E03), and reliability metrics (E08). Provides strategic prioritization for remediation. High ICE score, clear business value.
implementation_order.decision_framework: Risk-adjusted ROI with temporal urgency factors

implementation_order.name: Attack Path Modeling & Simulation
implementation_order.rationale: ADVANCED THREAT ANALYSIS. Requires SBOM (E03), safety zones (E07), reliability (E08), economic impact (E10), and prioritization (E12). Complex graph algorithms but high defensive value.
implementation_order.graph_algorithms: A*, Dijkstra for multi-stage attack path calculation

implementation_order.name: Organizational Blind Spot Detection
implementation_order.rationale: PSYCHOMETRIC CORE. Requires GDPR compliance (E09), demographics baseline (E11), and attack modeling (E13) for threat exploitation patterns. 10-agent mathematical framework. Foundation for other cognitive modules.
implementation_order.methodology: Psychometric gradient computation, cognitive bias quantification (30 biases)

implementation_order.name: Personality-Team Fit Calculus
implementation_order.rationale: TEAM OPTIMIZATION. Requires GDPR (E09), demographics (E11), and blind spot detection (E19) for team cognitive profile. 10-agent system with 16-dimensional personality vectors. Enables team dynamics analysis (E18).
implementation_order.assessments: Big Five, Dark Triad, Cognitive Styles, Behavioral dimensions

implementation_order.name: Transcript Psychometric NER
implementation_order.rationale: NLP PSYCHOMETRICS. Requires GDPR (E09), demographics (E11), and personality framework (E20). Complex NLP/NER task extracting personality traits from text. Enables dissonance breaking (E24) and threat actor profiling (E25).
implementation_order.technology: Advanced NER for psychological trait extraction from unstructured text

implementation_order.name: Cognitive Dissonance Breaking Points
implementation_order.rationale: INFLUENCE OPERATIONS. Requires blind spot detection (E19), personality modeling (E20), and transcript analysis (E21). Identifies psychological breaking points for social engineering defense. Enables threat actor psychology (E25).
implementation_order.application: Defensive social engineering detection, security awareness training optimization

implementation_order.name: Threat Actor Personality Profiling
implementation_order.rationale: ADVERSARY PSYCHOLOGY. Requires personality framework (E20), transcript NER (E21), and dissonance detection (E24). Profiles threat actors for behavioral prediction. High impact for threat intelligence.
implementation_order.profiling: Psychological profiles of threat actors for behavioral prediction

implementation_order.name: Lacanian Dyad Analysis (Leader-Follower)
implementation_order.rationale: ADVANCED PSYCHOLOGY. Requires demographics (E11), personality modeling (E20), and threat actor profiling (E25). Psychoanalytic framework for leader-follower dynamics. Lower priority, enables triad analysis (E18).
implementation_order.theory: Lacanian psychoanalytic framework for dyadic power relationships

implementation_order.name: Triad Group Dynamics Analysis
implementation_order.rationale: ADVANCED PSYCHOLOGY. Requires dyad analysis (E17) and team fit modeling (E20). Three-person group dynamics for insider threat detection. Lower confidence, complex theory.
implementation_order.application: Insider threat detection via group dynamics analysis

implementation_order.name: Seldon Crisis Prediction (Psychohistory)
implementation_order.rationale: CAPSTONE - HIGHEST RISK. Requires demographics (E11), attack modeling (E13), dyad/triad analysis (E17, E18), and threat actor profiling (E25). Revolutionary predictive capability but lowest confidence and highest complexity. Save for last when all foundations are mature.
implementation_order.ambition: Large-scale societal event prediction through psychohistory mathematics

implementation_order.name: Population Event Forecasting
implementation_order.rationale: CAPSTONE - EXPERIMENTAL. Requires all psychometric foundations (E11, E18, E22, E25) plus attack modeling (E13). Population-level behavioral forecasting. Extremely experimental, save for absolute last.
implementation_order.research_status: Experimental - requires extensive validation before operational use

phase_1.name: Foundation Infrastructure
objectives: Equipment models and vendor data integrated
Core infrastructure ready for safety and economic modules
success_criteria: Customer labels implemented on all nodes

phase_2.name: Safety, Security & Compliance
objectives: Foundation for economic and prioritization modules

phase_5.name: Advanced Psychohistory (Experimental)
phase_5.risk_warning: Phase 5 enhancements are EXPERIMENTAL and require extensive validation before operational use. Prioritize only after Phases 1-4 are mature and stable.

phase_1.note: Can execute in parallel after Customer Labels foundation

phase_2.note: Can execute in parallel, E03 waits for E15 completion

phase_3.note: Demographics and economic modeling are independent

phase_4.note: Blind spots and team fit can execute in parallel after E11

phase_1.mitigation: Mandatory schema validation, automated label application

phase_2.mitigation: 10-agent validation swarm with format detection and correction

phase_3.mitigation: Start with industry benchmarks, refine with customer data over time

phase_4.mitigation: Strict anonymization, explicit consent, audit trails (E09 prerequisite)

phase_5.risk: Experimental psychohistory models have low confidence
phase_5.mitigation: Extensive validation, research status, NOT for operational decisions without validation

phase_1_completion.value: Multi-tenant infrastructure, safety zone modeling, vendor intelligence

phase_2_completion.value: Vulnerability tracking, compliance reporting, reliability metrics

phase_3_completion.value: Economic impact analysis, strategic prioritization, attack simulation

phase_4_completion.value: Organizational psychology, team optimization, threat actor profiling

recommendations.prioritization_strategy: Foundation-first with progressive complexity. Build multi-tenant infrastructure (Customer Labels), then safety and security foundations (E07, E15, E08, E09, E03), then economic decision support (E10, E12, E13), then psychometric capabilities (E19-E25), finally experimental psychohistory (E17, E18, E22, E23).
recommendations.execution_approach: Execute each phase completely before starting next. Validate success criteria before advancing. Use parallel execution opportunities within phases to accelerate delivery.
recommendations.risk_management: Phase 5 enhancements (E17, E18, E22, E23) are EXPERIMENTAL with low confidence scores. Extensive validation required before operational use. Consider these research initiatives, not production capabilities.
recommendations.quick_wins: Customer Labels (5 days), E09 GDPR (8 days), E11 Demographics (8 days) provide immediate compliance and foundation value.
recommendations.long_term_value: E03 SBOM (10-agent swarm), E13 Attack Paths, and E19 Blind Spots provide the highest long-term defensive capability.
recommendations.resource_allocation: Phases 1-3 are well-defined with clear technical paths. Phases 4-5 require specialized psychometric expertise and research validation. Budget accordingly.
recommendations.success_metrics: Track McKenney Question coverage, operational readiness, and business value delivery at each phase completion. Maintain audit trail for compliance and validation.
